intro: Phyteuma persicifolium f. carniolicum, commonly known as the Carniolan phyteuma, is a compact, herbaceous perennial belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of bell-shaped, pale blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The leaves are lanceolate, with a silvery-gray underside, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Native to the Alps, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. It is often cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
